SENT.plain: Unilateral cerebral infarcts were produced in the rat by ligation of one common carotid artery and subsequent exposure to carbon monoxide
The incidence and extension of brain infarcts was increased in animals with additional ipsilateral cervical preganglionic sympathectomy
Sympathectomy did not affect markedly the respiration and systemic circulation
The effect of sympathectomy was attributed to a cutaneous vasodilation, leading to an extracranial steal phenomenon
